    Have a Question? Ask MRSC!

    Eligible government agencies can use our free Ask MRSC service.

    With one call or click you can get a personalized answer from one of our trusted attorneys, or policy consultants!

    Upcoming Events

    Upcoming Trainings – Attend our live webinars, virtual workshops, and in-person trainings to learn about key local government issues!

    Digging Into Public Works – In-person regional forums and training resources for public works staff and local contractors

    On-Demand

    On-Demand Webinars – Watch pre-recorded versions of our recent webinars, at your own convenience.

     

    PRA/OPMA E-Learning Courses – Free video courses for city/town elected officials on the Public Records Act (PRA) and Open Public Meetings Act (OPMA).

  • About Us

    What We Do

    About MRSC – Learn about MRSC's mission and history.

    MRSC Services – Learn more about the many services MRSC provides for local government staff and officials.

    Procurement Services (mrscrosters.org)

    MRSC Rosters – Connect with businesses for small public works contracts, purchases, services, and consultants

    MRSC Electronic Bidding – Reduce administrative effort and move your bidding processes online, including sealed bids

    Who We Are

    Staff Directory – Learn more about our staff members or email them directly.

    Join Our Team – See our current job opportunities and learn about our guiding values and benefits.

    Board of Directors – See our current board membership.

    Contact Us – Send us your comments, submit media requests, let us know about broken links, and more.

Washington City and Town Profiles

Below are profiles for all cities and towns in Washington State, including information on population size, classification, form of government, and more. Click on the name of any city for detailed information on city officials and contact information, as well as links to important documents such as the city codes, budgets, and comprehensive plans.

You can also Search For City/Town Officials.

If you need to update the information for your city or town, click on your jurisdiction's name and then "City Officials" (to update the officials) or "Update City/Town Profile" (for all other changes).

Washington City + Town Officials Directory Mobile App
The officials information is now available for free as a mobile/tablet application.

Want to search multiple city codes or websites at once? See our City and County Websites Search and Washington City Codes.

The population figures shown below reflect the official April 1, 2024 population estimates released by the Washington Office of Financial Management (OFM).

The 2025 population estimates will be released around June 30, 2025. To see recent population trends, refer to our Tax and Population Data topic page.

To jump to a specific city, select the first letter of the city's name:


  • A
  • B
  • C
  • D
  • E
  • F
  • G
  • H
  • I
  • J
  • K

  • N
  • O

  • Q

  • W

Disclaimer: MRSC is a statewide resource that provides general legal and policy guidance to support local government entities in Washington State pursuant to chapter 43.110 RCW. MRSC website content is for informational purposes only and is not intended as legal advice, nor as a substitute for the legal advice of an attorney. You should contact your own legal counsel if you have a question regarding your legal rights or any other legal issue.
